page.title: 14REDHILL TOWN (2)
page.content:
In the 1980's the face of REDHILL is changing dramatically. Redhill used to be a Victorian Railway Town but is now changing into a modern office complex which is trying to attract people out of London. Other things are changing too, the old Football Stadium was pulled down earlier this year and the football ground is being turned into a park.
The railway station is still very important to the town. It provides one of the main links to London and is used everyday by thousands of people, businessman, tourists and locals alike. There are trains to{VICTORIA} and{LONDON BRIDGE}every twenty minutes. The station is near the town centre and is just a few minutes walk from several local schools so is often used by shoppers and schoolchildren.
